wisdom.quote: A man is what he thinks about all day long
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nothing is more simple than greatness; indeed, to be simple is to be great
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beware what you set your heart upon. For it surely shall be yours
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Good luck is another name for tenacity of purpose
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Don’t be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I like the silent church before the service begins, better than any preaching
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson>

wisdom.quote: A man must consider what a rich realm he abdicates when he becomes a conformist
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Solitude, the safeguard of mediocrity, is to genius the stern friend
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do that which is assigned you, and you cannot hope too much or dare too much
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make the most of yourself for that is all there is of you
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is one of the most beautiful compensations of life, that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Speak the truth, and all nature and all spirits help you with unexpected furtherance
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Sometimes a scream is better than a thesis
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Journals 1822–1863)

wisdom.quote: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The first wealth is health
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He is rich who owns the day, and no one owns the day who allows it to be invaded with fret and anxiety
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Great men exist that there may be greater men
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Representative Men)

wisdom.quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We judge of man’s wisdom by his hope
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The health of the eye seems to demand a horizon. We are never tired, so long as we can see far enough
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: God will not have his work made manifest by cowards. Always, always, always, always, always do what you are afraid to do. Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We walk alone in the world. Friends, such as we desire, are dreams and fables
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. You have to win it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Better to know a few things which are good and necessary than many things which are useless and mediocre
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Wherever a man comes, there comes revolution. The old is for slaves
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: You shall have joy, or you shall have power, said God; you shall not have both
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The soul active sees absolute truth; and utters truth, or creates
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Great men are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force, that thoughts rule the world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Be silly. Be honest. Be kind
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our strength grows out of our weakness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: Every artist was first an amateur
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I awoke this morning with devout thanksgiving for my friends, the old and the new
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We become what we think about all day long
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A great man is always willing to be little
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The years teach much which the days never know
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: Second Series)

wisdom.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What you are comes to you
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our greatest strength lies not in never having fallen, but in rising every time we fall
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To laugh often and much; To win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children; To earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends; To appreciate beauty, to find the best in others; To leave the world a bit better, whether by a healthy child, a garden patch or a redeemed social condition; To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life is a journey, not a destination
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God’s handwriting
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Build a better mousetrap, and the world will beat a path to your door
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Imitation is suicide
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life is our dictionary
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Sprinkle joy
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The one prudence in life is concentration
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Truth is our element
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Valor consists in the power of self recovery
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Blame is safer than praise
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson)

wisdom.quote: Live well, learn plenty, laugh often, love much
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Genius is religious
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The Over-Soul)

wisdom.quote: Life is a progress, and not a station
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our faith comes in moments; our vice is habitual
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: First Series)

wisdom.quote: A man is a god in ruins
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Science does not know its debt to imagination
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Letters and Social Aims)

wisdom.quote: Do the thing and you will have the power
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The wise through excess of wisdom is made a fool
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Sorrow looks back, worry looks around, faith looks up
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This world belongs to the energetic
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Thought is the seed of action
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Be yourself; no base imitator of another, but your best self
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: There is something which you can do better than another. Listen to the inward voice and bravely obey that. Do the things at which you are great, not what you were never made for
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Even in the mud and scum of things, something always, always sings
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He needs no library, for he has not done thinking; no church, for he is himself a prophet; no statute book, for he hath the Lawgiver; no money, for he is value itself; no road, for he is at home where he is
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: But genius looks forward. The eyes of men are set in his forehead, not in his hindhead. Man hopes. Genius creates
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities, no doubt crept in. Forget them as soon as you can, tomorrow is a new day; begin it well and serenely, with too high a spirit to be cumbered with your old nonsense
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This new day is too dear, with its hopes and invitations, to waste a moment on the yesterdays
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Is it so bad then to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: No facts are to me sacred; none are profane; I simply experiment, an endless seeker with no past at my back
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The invariable mark of a dream is to see it come true
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Insist on yourself; never imitate. Your own gift you can present every moment with the cumulative force of a whole life’s cultivation: but of the adopted talent of another, you gave only an extemporaneous, half possession
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The one thing which we seek with insatiable desire is to forget ourselves, to be surprised out of our propriety, to lose our sempiternal memory and to do something without knowing how or why; in short to draw a new circle
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The way of life is wonderful. It is by abandonment. The great moments of history are the facilities of performance through the strength of ideas, as the works of genius and religion
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Enthusiasm is one of the most powerful engines of success. When you do a thing, do it with all your might. Put your whole soul into it. Stamp it with your own personality. Be active, be energetic, be enthusiastic and faithful, and you will accomplish your object
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every genuine work of art has as much reason for being as the earth and the sun
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: ‘Tis not important how the hero does this or that, but what he is
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It will never make any difference to a hero what the laws are. His greatness will shine and accomplish itself unto the end, whether they second him or not
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Work and acquire, and thou hast chained the wheel of chance
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Each man is a hero and an oracle to somebody
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Letters and Social Aims)

wisdom.quote: Who you are speaks so loudly I can’t hear what you’re saying
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: My evening visitors, if they cannot see the clock should find the time in my face
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Next to the originator of a good sentence is the first quoter of it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A great man quotes bravely, and will not draw on his invention when his memory serves him with a word just as good
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Letters and Social Aims)

wisdom.quote: By necessity, by proclivity, and by delight, we all quote
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We do what we must, and call it by the best names we can
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: Second Series)

wisdom.quote: Do what we can, summer will have its flies: if we walk in the woods, we must feed mosquitos: if we go a-fishing, we must expect a wet coat
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: First Series)

wisdom.quote: Every really able man, in whatever direction he work,—a man of large affairs, an inventor, a statesman, an orator, a poet, a painter,—if you talk sincerely with him, considers his work, however much admired, as far short of what it should be
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The dull pray; the geniuses are light mockers
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Representative Men)

wisdom.quote: People only see what they are prepared to see
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Each of us sees in others what we carry in our own hearts
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every burned book enlightens the world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The reality is more excellent than the report
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: You have just dined, and however scrupulously the slaughterhouse is concealed in the graceful distance of miles, there is complicity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Money often costs too much
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I chide society, I embrace solitude, and yet I am not so ungrateful as not to see the wise, the lovely and the noble-minded, as from time to time they pass my gate
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The reason why the world lacks unity, and lies broken and in heaps, is, because man is disunited with himself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Violence is not power, but the absence of power
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We are reformers in spring and summer; in autumn and winter, we stand by the old; reformers in the morning, conservers at night
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: Can anybody remember when the times were not hard and money not scarce?
A cynic can chill and dishearten with a single word
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Masses are rude, lame, unmade, pernicious in their demands and influence, and need not to be flattered, but to be schooled. I wish not to concede anything to them, but to tame, drill, divide, and break them up, and draw individuals out of them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Go put your creed into the deed, nor speak with double tongue
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Be as beneficent as the sun or the sea, but if your rights as a rational being are trenched on, die on the first inch of your territory
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our life is an apprenticeship to the truth that around every circle another can be drawn; that there is no end in nature, but every end is a beginning, and under every deep a lower deep opens
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Most of the shadows of this life are caused by our standing in our own sunshine
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Conversation is a game of circles. In conversation we pluck up the termini which bound the common of silence on every side
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Everything in the universe goes by indirection. There are no straight lines
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not believe that possibly you can escape the reward of your action
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Public opinion, I am sorry to say, will bear a great deal of nonsense. There is scarcely any absurdity so gross, whether in religion, politics, science or manners, which it will not bear
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: No matter how you seem to fatten on a crime, there can never be good for the bee which is bad for the hive
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Shall we then judge a country by the majority, or by the minority? By the minority, surely
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: For what avail the plough or sail, or land or life, if freedom fail?
The end of the human race will be that it will eventually die of civilization
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The eyes indicate the antiquity of the soul
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let me never fall into the vulgar mistake of dreaming that I am persecuted whenever I am contradicted
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: As to methods there may be a million and then some, but principles are few. The man who grasps principles can successfully select his own methods. The man who tries methods, ignoring principles, is sure to have trouble
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every actual State is corrupt. Good men must not obey laws too well
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If you would lift me you must be on higher ground. If you would liberate me you must be free. If you would correct my false view of facts, — hold up to me the same facts in the true order of thought, and I cannot go back from the new conviction
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Society and Solitude)

wisdom.quote: Every excess causes a defect; every defect an excess. Every sweet hath its sour; every evil its good
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: Heroism feels and never reasons and therefore is always right
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The good are befriended even by weakness and defect. As no man had ever a point of pride that was not injurious to him, so no man had ever a defect that was not somewhere made useful to him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: Every man in his lifetime needs to thank his faults
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: No man thoroughly understands a truth until he has contended against it, so no man has a thorough acquaintance with the hindrances or talents of men, until he has suffered from the one, and seen the triumph of the other over his own want of the same
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: He who has put forth his total strength in fit actions, has the richest return of wisdom
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: For every grain of wit there is a grain of folly
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is the duty of men to judge men only by their actions. Our faculties furnish us with no means of arriving at the motive, the character, the secret self. We call the tree good from its fruits, and the man, from his works
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: An original sentence, a step forward, is worth more than all the censures
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: People wish to be settled: only as far as they are unsettled is there any hope for them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: For every thing you have missed, you have gained something else; and for everything you gain, you lose something else
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The meaning of good and bad, of better and worse, is simply helping or hurting
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey’s end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom
wisdom.author: (Essays: Second Series)

wisdom.quote: Want is a growing giant whom the coat of Have was never large enough to cover
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The Conduct of Life)

wisdom.quote: The thing done avails, and not what is said about it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To fill the hour – that is happiness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Happy is the hearing man; unhappy the speaking man
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life is a train of moods like a string of beads; and as we pass through them they prove to be many colored lenses, which paint the world their aint the world their own hue, and each shows us only what lies in its own focus
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: Second Series)

wisdom.quote: We are always getting ready to live but never living
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Journals 1822–1863)

wisdom.quote: A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best; but what he has said or done otherwise, shall give him no peace
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: And in the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All the good of nature is the soul’s, and may be had, if paid for in nature’s lawful coin, that is, by labor which the heart and the head allow
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I no longer wish to meet a good I do not earn, for example, to find a pot of buried gold, knowing that it brings with it new burdens
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I do not wish more external goods, — neither possessions, nor honors, nor powers, nor persons. The gain is apparent; the tax is certain
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Explore, and explore, and explore. Be neither chided nor flattered out of your position of perpetual inquiry. Neither dogmatise yourself, nor accept another’s dogmatism. Why should you renounce your right to traverse the star-lit deserts of truth, for the premature comforts of an acre, house, and barn? Truth also has its roof, and bed, and board
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make yourself necessary to the world, and mankind will give you bread, and if not store of it, yet such as shall not take away your property in all men’s possessions, in all men’s affections, in art, in nature, and in hope
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: But man postpones or remembers; he does not live in the present, but with reverted eye laments the past, or, heedless of the riches that surround him, stands on tiptoe to foresee the future
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He cannot be happy and strong until he too lives with nature in the present, above time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What your heart thinks is great, is great. The soul’s emphasis is always right
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your reactions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: ‘Tis curious that we only believe as deeply as we live
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Cultivate the habit of being grateful for every good thing that comes to you, and to give thanks continuously. And because all things have contributed to your advancement, you should include all things in your gratitude
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is no beautifier of complexion, or form, or behavior, like the wish to scatter joy and not pain around us
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He is rich who owns the day, and no one owns the day who allows it to be invaded with fret and anxiety
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Be not the slave of your own past – plunge into the sublime seas, dive deep, and swim far, so you shall come back with new self-respect, with new power, and with an advanced experience that shall explain and overlook the old
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Love and you shall be loved
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We must be our own before we can be another’s
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The least defect of self-possession vitiates, in my judgment, the entire relation
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There can never be deep peace between two spirits, never mutual respect until, in their dialogue, each stands for the whole world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Peace cannot be achieved through violence, it can only be attained through understanding
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Without a rich heart, wealth is an ugly beggar
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: Is not marriage an open question, when it is alleged, from the beginning of the world, that such as are in the institution wish to get out, and such as are out wish to get in?
The real and lasting victories are those of peace and not of war
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Truth is handsomer than the affectation of love
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I must be myself. I cannot break myself any longer for you, or you. If you can love me for what I am, we shall be the happier. If you cannot, I will still seek to deserve that you should
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: If you are true, but not in the same truth with me, cleave to your companions; I will seek my own. I do this not selfishly, but humbly and truly. It is alike your interest, and mine, and all men’s, however long we have dwelt in lies, to live in truth
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There can be no excess to love; none to knowledge; none to beauty, when these attributes are considered in the purest sense
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: The love that you withhold is the pain that you carry
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All mankind love a lover
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This is my wish for you: Comfort on difficult days, smiles when sadness intrudes, rainbows to follow the clouds, laughter to kiss your lips, sunsets to warm your heart, hugs when spirits sag, beauty for your eyes to see, friendships to brighten your being, faith so that you can believe, confidence for when you doubt, courage to know yourself, patience to accept the truth, love to complete your life
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Don’t choose the better person, choose the person who makes a better you
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody. Do not make life hard to any
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The only gift is a portion of thyself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The earth laughs in flowers
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The charming landscape which I saw this morning is indubitably made up of some 20 or 30 farms. Miller owns this field, Locke that, and Manning the woodland beyond. But none of them owns the landscape
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is a property in the horizon which no man has but he whose eye can integrate all the parts, that is, the poet
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have not yet been discovered
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The happiest man is he who learns from nature the lesson of worship
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay, Amazon Book)

wisdom.quote: Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Everything in nature contains all the power of nature. Everything is made of one hidden stuff
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If a man has good corn or wood, or boards, or pigs to sell, or can make better chairs or knives, crucibles or church organs, than anybody else, you will find a broad hard-beaten road to his house, though it be in the woods
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The ancient precept, "Know thyself", and the modern precept, "Study nature", become at last one maxim
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: If the stars should appear one night in a thousand years, how would men believe and adore, and preserve for many generations the remembrance of the city of God which had been shown
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature never wears a mean appearance. Neither does the wisest man extort her secret, and lose his curiosity by finding out all her perfection
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature never became a toy to a wise spirit. The flowers, the animals, the mountains, reflected the wisdom of his best hour, as much as they had delighted the simplicity of his childhood
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To speak truly, few adult persons can see nature. Most persons do not see the sun. At least they have a very superficial seeing
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The sun illuminates only the eye of the man, but shines into the eye and the heart of the child
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The lover of nature is he whose inward and outward senses are still truly adjusted to each other; who has retained the spirit of infancy even into the era of manhood. His intercourse with heaven and earth, becomes part of his daily food
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: These roses under my window make no reference to former roses or to better ones; they are for what they are; they exist with God to-day. There is no time to them. There is simply the rose; it is perfect in every moment of its existence
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature hates monopolies and exceptions
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every sunset brings the promise of a new dawn
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The world globes itself in a drop of dew
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let us draw a lesson from nature, which always works by short ways. When the fruit is ripe, it falls
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: But if a man would be alone, let him look at the stars. The rays that come from those heavenly worlds, will separate between him and vulgar things
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: It is one light which beams out of a thousand stars. It is one soul which animates all men
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: The power of Nature predominates over the human will in all works of even the fine arts, in all that respects their material and external circumstances. Nature paints the best part of the picture, carves the best part of the statue, builds the best part of the house, and speaks the best part of the oration
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Society and Solitude)

wisdom.quote: The greatest wonder is that we can see these trees and not wonder more
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let him go where he will, he can only find so much beauty or worth as he carries
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beauty without expression is boring
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beauty is the mark God sets upon virtue
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: We are immersed in beauty, but our eyes have no clear vision
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson)

wisdom.quote: Do not waste yourself in rejection, nor bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To the attentive eye, each moment of the year has its own beauty, and in the same fields, it beholds, every hour, a picture which was never seen before, and which shall never be seen again
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: There are many beauties; as, of general nature, of the human face and form, of manners, of brain, or method, moral beauty, or beauty of the soul
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The moral sense reappears today with the same morning newness that has been from of old the fountain of beauty and strength
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: On stars: Every night come out these envoys of beauty, and light the universe with their admonishing smile
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The poet, the painter, the sculptor, the musician, the architect, seek each to concentrate this radiance of the world on one point, and each in his several work to satisfy the love of beauty which stimulates him to produce
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: We ascribe beauty to that which is simple; which has no superfluous parts; which exactly answers its end. […] It is the most enduring quality, and the most ascending quality
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beauty rests on necessities. The line of beauty is the result of perfect economy
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Truth, and goodness, and beauty are but different faces of the same all
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Self-command is the main elegance
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Self-reliance, the height and perfection of man, is reliance on God
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself. Nothing can bring you peace but the triumph of principles
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: If the single man plant himself indomitably on his instincts, and there abide, the huge world will come round to him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We wish to be self-sustained. We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Your genuine action will explain itself, and will explain your other genuine actions. Your conformity explains nothing
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I have been writing and speaking what were once called novelties, for twenty five or thirty years, & have not now one disciple. Why? Not that what I said was not true; not that it has not found intelligent receivers but because it did not go from any wish in me to bring men to me, but to themselves
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not yet see, that, if the single man plant himself indomitably on his instincts, and there abide, the huge world will come round to him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All our progress is an unfolding, like the vegetable bud. You have first an instinct, then an opinion, then a knowledge, as the plant has root, bud, and fruit
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: First Series)

wisdom.quote: Trust the instinct to the end, though you can render no reason. It is vain to hurry it. By trusting it to the end it shall ripen into truth, and you shall know why you believe
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To believe your own thought, to believe that what is true for you in your private heart is true for all men — that is genius
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A man should learn to detect and watch that gleam of light which flashes across his mind from within, more than the lustre of the firmament of bards and sages. Yet he dismisses without notice his thought, because it is his
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is easy to live for others, everybody does. I call on you to live for yourself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We but half express ourselves, and are ashamed of that divine idea which each of us represents
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Accept the place the divine providence has found for you, the society of your contemporaries, the connection of events. Great men have always done so
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I will so trust that what is deep is holy, that I will do strongly before the sun and moon whatever only rejoices me, and the heart appoints
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A complete man should need no auxiliaries to his personal presence
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: On Henry David Thoreau: He chose to be rich by making his wants few, and supplying them himself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Self-trust is the essence of heroism. […] It speaks the truth, and it is just, generous, hospitable, temperate, scornful of petty calculations, and scornful of being scorned
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Discontent is the want of self-reliance: it is infirmity of will
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: If a man own land, the land owns him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Fear defeats more people than any other one thing in the world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our distrust is very expensive
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It was a high counsel that I once heard given to a young person, — "always do what you are afraid to do"
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Essays: First Series)

wisdom.quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Don’t waste life in doubts and fears; spend yourself on the work before you, well assured that the right performance of this hour’s duties will be the best preparation for the hours and ages that will follow it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When a resolute young fellow steps up to the great bully, the world, and takes him boldly by the beard, he is often surprised to find it comes off in his hand, and that it was only tied on to scare away the timid adventurers
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What a man does, that he has. What has he to do with hope or fear? In himself is his might. Let him regard no good as solid but that which is in his nature, and which must grow out of him as long as he exists. The goods of fortune may come and go like summer leaves; let him scatter them on every wind as the momentary signs of his infinite productiveness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Fear is an instructor of great sagacity, and the herald of all revolutions
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: What a new face courage puts on everything!
The wise man throws himself on the side of his assailants. It is more his interest than it is theirs to find his weak point
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In general, every evil to which we do not succumb is a benefactor
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: Great men, great nations, have not been boasters and buffoons, but perceivers of the terror of life, and have manned themselves to face it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whatever limits us we call fate
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: That what we seek we shall find; what we flee from flees from us
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Action is with the scholar subordinate, but it is essential. Without it, he is not yet man. Without it, thought can never ripen into truth
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Free should the scholar be, — free and brave… Brave; for fear is a thing, which a scholar by his very function puts behind him. Fear always springs from ignorance… The world is his, who can see through its pretension
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Courage charms us, because it indicates that a man loves an idea better than all things in the world, that he is thinking neither of his bed, nor his dinner, nor his money, but will venture all to put in act the invisible thought of his mind
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The characteristic of a genuine heroism is its persistency
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The heroic cannot be the common, nor the common the heroic
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: At times the whole world seems to be in conspiracy to importune you with emphatic trifles. Friend, client, child, sickness, fear, want, charity, all knock at once at thy closet door and say,—’Come out unto us.’ But keep thy state; come not into their confusion
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson)

wisdom.quote: The best lightning rod for your protection is your own spine
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In skating over thin ice our safety is in our speed
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The secret of education lies in respecting the pupil
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Every man is a quotation from all his ancestors
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education, but the means to an education
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In my walks, every man I meet is my superior in some way, and in that I learn from him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The boy wishes to learn to skate, to coast, to catch a fish in the brook, to hit a mark with a snowball or a stone; and a boy a little older is just as well pleased to teach him these sciences
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The search after the great men is the dream of youth, and the most serious occupation of manhood
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Books are the best of things, well used; abused, the worst. What is the right use? What is the end which all means go to effect? They are for nothing but to inspire
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: Colleges… can only highly serve us, when they aim not to drill, but to create; when they gather from far every ray of various genius to their hospitable halls, and, by the concentrated fires, set the hearts of their youth on flame
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is properly no history; only biography
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Children are all foreigners
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Many times the reading of a book has made the future of a man
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Never read any book that is not a year old
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (In Praise Of Books)

wisdom.quote: Books are the best type of the influence of the past… The theory of books is noble
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Respect the child. Be not too much his parent. Trespass not on his solitude
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We are students of words: we are shut up in schools, and colleges, and recitation -rooms, for ten or fifteen years, and come out at last with a bag of wind, a memory of words, and do not know a thing
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is a time in every man’s education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance; that imitation is suicide; that he must take himself for better for worse as his portion
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We are too civil to books. For a few golden sentences we will turn over and actually read a volume of four or five hundred pages
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Some books leave us free and some books make us free
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The mind, once stretched by a new idea, never returns to its original dimensions
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There never was a child so lovely, but his mother was glad to get him asleep
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Respect the child. Wait and see the new product of Nature. Nature loves analogies, but not repetitions. Respect the child. Be not too much his parent. Trespass not on his solitude
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Poetry teaches the enormous force of a few words, and, in proportion to the inspiration, checks loquacity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Literature is the effort of man to indemnify himself for the wrongs of his condition
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: See in college how we thwart the natural love of learning by leaving the natural method of teaching what each wishes to learn, and insisting that you shall learn what you have no taste or capacity for
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The college, which should be a place of delightful labour, is made odious and unhealthy, and the young men are tempted to frivolous amusements to rally their jaded spirits
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Scholarship is to be created not by compulsion, but by awakening a pure interest in knowledge. The wise instructor accomplishes this by opening to his pupils precisely the attractions the study has for himself. The marking is a system for schools, not for the college; for boys, not for men; and it is an ungracious work to put on a professor
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The man who can make hard things easy is the educator
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The measure of a master is his success in bringing all men round to his opinion twenty years later
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Shall I tell you the secret of the true scholar? It is this: Every man I meet is my master in some point, and in that I learn of him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In the highest civilization, the book is still the highest delight. He who has once known its satisfactions is provided with a resource against calamity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Genius borrows nobly. When Shakespeare is charged with debts to his authors, Landor replies: "Yet he was more original than his originals. He breathed upon dead bodies and brought them into life"
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The intellect is vagabond, and our system of education fosters restlessness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is no knowledge that is not power
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Men are what their mothers made them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Skill to do comes of doing
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life consists of what man is thinking about all day
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The ancestor of every action is a thought
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Good thoughts are no better than good dreams, unless they be executed
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The Gods we worship write their names on our faces; be sure of that
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When we have new perception, we shall gladly disburden the memory of its hoarded treasures as old rubbish
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A person will worship something, have no doubt about that. We may think our tribute is paid in secret in the dark recesses of our hearts, but it will come out. That which dominates our imaginations and our thoughts will determine our lives, and our character. Therefore, it behooves us to be careful what we worship, for what we are worshipping, we are becoming
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: To different minds, the same world is a hell, and a heaven
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Journals 1822–1863)

wisdom.quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Beware when the great God lets loose a thinker on this planet
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Do not say things. What you are stands over you the while, and thunders, so that I cannot hear what you say to the contrary
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Letters and Social Aims)

wisdom.quote: Every man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins. We parry and fend the approach of our fellow-man by compliments, by gossip, by amusements, by affairs. We cover up our thought from him under a hundred folds
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: By necessity, by proclivity, and by delight, we all quote. In fact, it is as difficult to appropriate the thoughts of others as it is to invent
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What I must do is all that concerns me, not what the people think. This rule, equally arduous in actual and intellectual life, may serve for the whole distinction between greatness and meanness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Stay at home in your mind. Don’t recite other people’s opinions
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What am I? And what is? Asks the human spirit with a curiosity new-kindled, but never to be quenched
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; Unbelief, in denying them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Judge of your natural character by what you do in your dreams
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A painter told me that nobody could draw a tree without in some sort becoming a tree; or draw a child by studying the outlines of its form merely… but by watching for a time his motions and plays, the painter enters into his nature and can then draw him at every attitude
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The purpose of life seems to be to acquaint a man with himself and whatever science or art or course of action he engages in reacts upon and illuminates the recesses of his own mind
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The best effect of fine persons is felt after we have left their presence
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The stars awaken a certain reverence, because though always present, they are inaccessible; but all natural objects make a kindred impression, when the mind is open to their influence
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We will walk on our own feet; we will work with our own hands; we will speak our own minds… A nation of men will for the first time exist, because each believes himself inspired by the Divine Soul which also inspires all men
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Thought is all light, and publishes itself to the universe. It will speak, though you were dumb, by its own miraculous organ. It will flow out of your actions, your manners, and your face. It will bring you friendships. It will impledge you to truth by the love and expectation of generous minds
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: Circles, like the soul, are never-ending and turn round and round without a stop
Things are pretty, graceful, rich, elegant, handsome, but, until they speak to the imagination, not yet beautiful
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Men love to wonder, and that is the seed of our science
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A good symbol is the best argument, and is a missionary to persuade thousands
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Your goodness must have some edge to it — else it is none
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Power ceases in the instant of repose; it resides in the moment of transition from a past to a new state, in the shooting of the gulf, in the darting to an aim
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Success treads on every right step. For the instinct is sure, that prompts him to tell his brother what he thinks. He then learns, that in going down into the secrets of his own mind, he has descended into the secrets of all minds
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Character is higher than intellect.[…] A great soul will be strong to live, as well as strong to think
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world’s opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whoso would be a man, must be a nonconformist. He who would gather immortal palms must not be hindered by the name of goodness, but must explore if it be goodness
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind. Absolve you to yourself, and you shall have the suffrage of the world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Shallow men believe in luck or circumstance. Strong men believe in cause and effect
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The imitator dooms himself to hopeless mediocrity. The inventor did it because it was natural to him, and so in him it has a charm
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The man who renounces himself, comes to himself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The good news is that the moment you decide that what you know is more important than what you have been taught to believe, you will have shifted gears in your quest for abundance. Success comes from within, not from without.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I hate to be defended in a newspaper. As long as all that is said is said against me, I feel a certain assurance of success. But as soon as honeyed words of praise are spoken for me, I feel as one that lies unprotected before his enemies
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Compensation, Essay)

wisdom.quote: The sublime is excited in me by the great stoical doctrine, obey thyself
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When you strike at a king, you must kill him
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When you were born you were crying and everyone else was smiling. Live your life so at the end, your’re the one who is smiling and everyone else is crying
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In failing circumstances no one can be relied on to keep their integrity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The good lawyer is not the man who has an eye to every side and angle of contingency, and qualifies all his qualifications, but who throws himself on your part so heartily, that he can get you out of a scrape
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds, adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines. With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. He may as well concern himself with his shadow on the wall
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whatever games are played with us, we must play no games with ourselves, but deal in our privacy with the last honesty and truth
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The mark of the man of the world is absence of pretension. He does not make a speech; he takes a low business-tone, avoids all brag, is nobody, dresses plainly, promises not at all, performs much, speaks in monosyllables, hugs his fact
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The greatest homage we can pay to truth is to use it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: As long as a man stands in his own way, everything seems to be in his way
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Happy is the house that shelters a friend
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The only reward of virtue is virtue; the only way to have a friend is to be one
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Friendship should be surrounded with ceremonies and respects, and not crushed into corners. Friendship requires more time than poor busy men can usually command
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly, and they will show themselves great
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him I may think aloud
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I am arrived at last in the presence of a man so real and equal that I may drop even those undermost garments of dissimulation, courtesy, and second thought, which men never put off, and may deal with him with the simplicity and wholeness, with which one chemical atom meets another
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The other element of friendship is tenderness. We are holden to men by every sort of tie, by blood, by pride, by fear, by hope, by lucre, by lust, by hate, by admiration, by every circumstance and badge and trifle, but we can scarce believe that so much character can subsist in another as to draw us by love
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life is short, but there is always time enough for courtesy
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Can another be so blessed, and we so pure, that we can offer him tenderness? When a man becomes dear to me, I have touched the goal of fortune
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Two may talk and one may hear, but three cannot take part in a conversation of the most sincere and searching sort
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Always scorn appearances, and you always may
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare, and he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The highest compact we can make with our fellow is, "Let there be truth between us two forever more"
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Friends seem to be only mirrors to draw out and explain to us ourselves; and that which draws us nearer our fellow man, is, that the deep Heart in one, answers the deep Heart in another, — that we find we have (a common Nature) — one life which runs through all individuals, and which is indeed Divine
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The condition which high friendship demands is ability to do without it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Our intellectual and active powers increase with our affection. The scholar sits down to write, and all his years of meditation do not furnish him with one good thought or happy expression; but it is necessary to write a letter to a friend, and, forthwith, troops of gentle thoughts invest themselves, on every hand, with chosen words
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I must feel pride in my friend’s accomplishments as if they were mine, and a property in his virtues. I feel as warmly when he is praised, as the lover when he hears applause of his engaged maiden
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I do not wish to treat friendships daintily, but with roughest courage. When they are real, they are not glass threads or frost-work, but the solidest thing we know
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I hate the prostitution of the name of friendship to signify modish and worldly alliances
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Friendship is for aid and comfort through all the relations and passages of life and death
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It is fit for serene days, and graceful gifts, and country rambles, but also for rough roads and hard fare, shipwreck, poverty, and persecution
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We are to dignify to each other the daily needs and offices of man’s life, and embellish it by courage, wisdom and unity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: It should never fall into something usual and settled, but should be alert and inventive, and add rhyme and reason to what was drudgery
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Friendship demands a religious treatment. We talk of choosing our friends, but friends are self-elected. Reverence is a great part of it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The essence of friendship is entireness, a total magnanimity and trust
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Other men are lenses through which we read our own minds
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Representative Men)

wisdom.quote: Let your greatness educate the crude and cold companion
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Men are better than their theology
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let us be silent, that we may hear the whisper of God
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: God enters by a private door into every individual
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The religion of one age is the literary entertainment of the next
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The progress of religion is steadily to its identity with morals. Strength enters just as much as the moral element prevails
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The god of the cannibals will be a cannibal, of the crusaders a crusader, and of the merchants a merchant
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The religion that is afraid of science dishonors God and commits suicide
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: In the matter of religion, people eagerly fasten their eyes on the difference between their own creed and yours; whilst the charm of the study is in finding the agreements and identities in all the religions of humanity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A sect or party is an elegant incognito devised to save a man from the vexation of thinking
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: In how many churches, by how many prophets, tell me, is man made sensible that he is an infinite Soul; that the earth and heavens are passing into his mind; that he is drinking forever the soul of God?
Religion is to do right. It is to love, it is to serve, it is to think, it is to be humble
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When a man lives with God, his voice shall be as sweet as the murmur of the brook and the rustle of the corn
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the creator for all I have not seen
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The faith that stands on authority is not faith
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The less government we have, the better — the fewer laws, and the less confided power
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Society everywhere is in conspiracy against the manhood of everyone of its members
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A nation never falls but by suicide
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Man exists for his own sake and not to add a laborer to the state
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The two parties which divide the state, the party of Conservatism and that of Innovation, are very old, and have disputed the possession of the world ever since it was made
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: These rabble at Washington … see, against the unanimous expression of the people, how much a little well-directed effrontery can achieve, how much crime the people will bear, and they proceed from step to step…

Conservatism stands on man’s confessed limitations; reform on his indisputable infinitude; conservatism on circumstance; liberalism on power; one goes to make an adroit member of the social frame; the other to postpone all things to the man himself; conservatism is debonnair and social; reform is individual and imperious
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Reform is affirmative, conservatism negative; conservatism goes for comfort, reform for truth
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Conservatism is more candid to behold another’s worth; reform more disposed to maintain and increase its own
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Conservatism makes no poetry, breathes no prayer, has no invention; it is all memory. Reform has no gratitude, no prudence, no husbandry
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When a whole nation is roaring Patriotism at the top of its voice, I am fain to explore the cleanness of its hands and the purity of its heart
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The true test of civilization is, not the census, nor the size of the cities, nor the crops – no, but the kind of man the country turns out
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: From Washington, proverbially ‘the city of distances,’ through all its cities, states, and territories, it is a country of beginnings, of projects, of designs, and expectations
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Those who stay away from the election think that one vote will do no good: ‘Tis but one step more to think one vote will do no harm
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: There is always a certain meanness in the argument of conservatism, joined with a certain superiority in its fact
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: These are the voices which we hear in solitude, but they grow faint and inaudible as we enter into the world
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Society is a wave. The wave moves onward, but the water of which it is composed does not
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: All men plume themselves on the improvement of society, and no man improves
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Let us leave hurry to slaves
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We ask for long life, but ’tis deep life, or noble moments that signify. Let the measure of time be spiritual, not mechanical
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Society and Solitude)

wisdom.quote: Time dissipates to shining ether the solid angularity of facts
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Speak your latent conviction, and it shall be the universal sense; for the inmost in due time becomes the outmost, — and our first thought is rendered back to us by the trumpets of the Last Judgment
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)

wisdom.quote: A man builds a fine house; and now he has a master, and a task for life: he is to furnish, watch, show it, and keep it in repair, the rest of his days
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Alcohol, hashish, prussic acid, strychnine are weak dilutions. The surest poison is time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I cannot remember the books I’ve read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Life is not so short but that there is always time enough for courtesy
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Letters and Social Aims)

wisdom.quote: Who hears me, who understands me, becomes mine, a possession for all time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Nature is methodical, and doeth her work well. Time is never to be hurried
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The imagination and the senses cannot be gratified at the same time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Manners require time, and nothing is more vulgar than haste
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This day is all that is good and fair. It is too dear, with its hopes and invitations, to waste a moment on the yesterdays
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Guard well your spare moments. They are like uncut diamonds. Discard them and their value will never be known. Improve them and they will become the brightest gems in a useful life
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: This time, like all times, is a very good one, if we but know what to do with it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Today is a king in disguise
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Grow angry slowly – there’s plenty of time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Finish each day before you begin the next, and interpose a solid wall of sleep between the two. This you cannot do without temperance
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Tobacco, coffee, alcohol, hashish, prussic acid, strychnine, are weak dilutions. The surest poison is time
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: So much of our time is spent in preparation, so much in routine, and so much in retrospect, that the amount of each person’s genius is confined to a very few hours
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: A moment is a concentrated eternity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Ralph Waldo Emerson
wisdom.quote: What would be the use of immortality to a person who cannot use well a half an hour?
Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Health is the first muse, and sleep is the condition to produce it
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Give me health and a day, and I will make the pomp of emperors ridiculous
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (Nature, Essay)

wisdom.quote: The imagination is not a talent of some men but is the health of every man
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The one thing in the world, of value, is the active soul
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson (The American Scholar)

wisdom.quote: Health is the condition of wisdom, and the sign is cheerfulness – an open and noble temper
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: When I go into the garden with a spade, and dig a bed, I feel such an exhilaration and health that I discover that I have been defrauding myself all this time in letting others do for me what I should have done with my own hands
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Sickness is poor-spirited, and cannot serve anyone; it must husband its resources to live. But health or fullness answers its own ends, and has to spare, runs over, and inundates the neighborhoods and creeks of other men’s necessities
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We forget ourselves and our destinies in health, and the chief use of temporary sickness is to remind us of these concerns
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Prudence is the virtue of the senses. […] It is content to seek health of body by complying with physical conditions, and health of mind by the laws of the intellect
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: I will say, get health. No labor, pains, temperance, poverty, nor exercise, that can gain it, must be grudged
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The best part of health is fine disposition. It is more essential than talent, even in the works of talent
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Whenever you are sincerely pleased, you are nourished. The joy of the spirit indicates its strength. All healthy things are sweet-tempered
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Intellectual tasting of life will not supersede muscular activity
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: We don’t grow old. When we cease to grow, we become old
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: What is true anywhere is true everywhere
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us, or we find it not (The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson)
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The voyage of the best ship is a zigzag line of a hundred tacks. See the line from a sufficient distance, and it straightens itself to the average tendency (Self-Reliance and Other Essays)
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Travelling is a fool’s paradise. Our first journeys discover to us the indifference of places
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: At home I dream that at Naples, at Rome, I can be intoxicated with beauty, and lose my sadness. I pack my trunk, embrace my friends, embark on the sea, and at last wake up in Naples, and there beside me is the stern fact, the sad self, unrelenting, identical, that I fled from. I seek the Vatican, and the palaces. I affect to be intoxicated with sights and suggestions, but I am not intoxicated. My giant goes with me wherever I go
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: The most advanced nations are always those who navigate the most
