wisdom.quote: Independent inquiry is needed in your search for truth, not dependence on anyone else’s view or a mere book
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: The important thing for you is to be alert, to question, to find out, so that your own initiative may be awakened
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Those who distrust the life-giving force within them, or who have none, are driven to compensate through such substitutes as money
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: When a man has confidence in himself, when all he wants in the world is to live out his destiny in freedom and purity, he comes to regard all those vastly overestimated and far too costly possessions as mere accessories, pleasant perhaps to have and make use of, but never essential
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Part 1. We should devote ourselves to being self-sufficient and must not depend upon the external rating by others for our happiness
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Part 2. So it is true that the more we values things, the less we value our self. The more we depend upon others for esteem, the less we are self-sufficient
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee
Bruce Lee
wisdom.quote: We realize that manipulation and control are not the ultimate joy of life – to become real, to learn to take a stand, to develop one’s center, to the support of our total personality, a release to spontaneity – yes, yes, yes!
Since life is an ever-evolving process, one should flow in this process and discover how to actualize and expand oneself
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Success means doing something sincerely and whole-heartedly
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Independent inquiry is needed in your search for truth, not dependence on anyone else’s view or a mere book
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: People have to grow by skillful frustrations, otherwise they have no incentive to develop their own means and ways of coping with the world
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Head toward self-expression and self-actualization and not just a means of mediocre functioning or repetitious drilling on a chosen pattern
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: My only sure reward is "in" my actions and not "from" them. The quality of my reward is in the depth of my response, the centralness of the part of me I act from
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: This world is very practical. You do more work, you get rewarded more; you do less work, you lose your rewards
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: When you are in the now, you can’t be anxious, because the excitement flows immediately into ongoing spontaneous activity
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Part 1. Oftentimes business people see not a human being but a product, a commodity. However, you, as a human being, have the right to be the best goddamn product that ever walked and work so hard that the business people have to listen to you
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Part 2. You have that personal obligation to yourself to make yourself the best product possible according to your own terms
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Part 3. Not the biggest or the most successful, but the best quality – with that achieved, comes everything else
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Action is a highroad to self-confidence and esteem. Where it is open, all energies flow toward it. It comes readily to most people, and its rewards are tangible
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: The main thing is not to expend one’s powers prematurely in an attempt to obtain by force something for which the time is not yet ripe
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: In order to realize our true self we must be willing to live without being dependent upon the opinion of others. When we are completely self-sufficient we can have no fear of not being esteemed by others
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: One should do nothing that is not natural or spontaneous; the important thing is not to strain in any way
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: Wait in the calm strength of patience – he that is strong should guard it with tenderness
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: I have to leave now, my friend. You have a long journey ahead of you, and you must travel light. From now on drop all your burden of preconceived conclusions behind. Remember, my friend, the usefulness of a cup is in its emptiness
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars.
wisdom.author: Elbert Hubbard

wisdom.quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Knowing others is intelligence;knowing yourself is true wisdom.Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

wisdom.quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
wisdom.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

wisdom.quote: Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someone’s life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance.
wisdom.author: Roy T. Bennett

wisdom.quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
wisdom.author: Roy T. Bennett

wisdom.quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.
wisdom.author: Kahlil Gibran

wisdom.quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
wisdom.author: Colette

wisdom.quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
wisdom.author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

wisdom.quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
wisdom.author: J.M. Barrie

wisdom.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
wisdom.author: Eckhart Tolle

wisdom.quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
wisdom.author: Paulo Coelho

wisdom.quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
wisdom.author: Truman Capote

wisdom.quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
wisdom.author: Joseph Campbell

wisdom.quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
wisdom.author: Bob Marley

wisdom.quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
wisdom.author: Jimi Hendrix

wisdom.quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg

wisdom.quote: I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?"It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties." "To establish ties?" "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

wisdom.quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
wisdom.author: Leo Tolstoy

wisdom.quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
wisdom.author: Rick Riordan

wisdom.quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
wisdom.author: Rumi

wisdom.quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.
wisdom.author: Paulo Coelho

wisdom.quote: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
wisdom.author: Voltaire

wisdom.quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
wisdom.author: John Keats

wisdom.quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
wisdom.author: Maya Angelou

wisdom.quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
wisdom.author: Bram Stoker

wisdom.quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
wisdom.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

wisdom.quote: Pain is a pesky part of being human, I've learned it feels like a stab wound to the heart, something I wish we could all do without, in our lives here. Pain is a sudden hurt that can't be escaped. But then I have also learned that because of pain, I can feel the beauty, tenderness, and freedom of healing. Pain feels like a fast stab wound to the heart. But then healing feels like the wind against your face when you are spreading your wings and flying through the air! We may not have wings growing out of our backs, but healing is the closest thing that will give us that wind against our faces.
wisdom.author: C. JoyBell C.

wisdom.quote: Anybody can look at a pretty girl and see a pretty girl. An artist can look at a pretty girl and see the old woman she will become. A better artist can look at an old woman and see the pretty girl that she used to be. But a great artist-a master-and that is what Auguste Rodin was-can look at an old woman, protray her exactly as she is...and force the viewer to see the pretty girl she used to be...and more than that, he can make anyone with the sensitivity of an armadillo, or even you, see that this lovely young girl is still alive, not old and ugly at all, but simply prisoned inside her ruined body. He can make you feel the quiet, endless tragedy that there was never a girl born who ever grew older than eighteen in her heart...no matter what the merciless hours have done to her. Look at her, Ben. Growing old doesn't matter to you and me; we were never meant to be admired-but it does to them.
wisdom.author: Robert Heinlein

wisdom.quote: We shall not cease from explorationAnd the end of all our exploringWill be to arrive where we startedAnd know the place for the first time.
wisdom.author: T. S. Eliot

wisdom.quote: Never, never, never give in!
wisdom.author: Winston S. Churchill

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it.
wisdom.author: Margaret Drabble

wisdom.quote: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
wisdom.author: H.L. Mencken

wisdom.quote: In youth, it was a way I had,To do my best to please.And change, with every passing ladTo suit his theories.But now I know the things I knowAnd do the things I do,And if you do not like me so,To hell, my love, with you.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
wisdom.author: Hermann Hesse

wisdom.quote: All knowledge hurts.
wisdom.author: Cassandra Clare

wisdom.quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.
wisdom.author: Helen Keller

wisdom.quote: There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself.
wisdom.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

wisdom.quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is. Most people love you for who you pretend to be. To keep their love, you keep pretending - performing. You get to love your pretence. It's true, we're locked in an image, an act - and the sad thing is, people get so used to their image, they grow attached to their masks. They love their chains. They forget all about who they really are. And if you try to remind them, they hate you for it, they feel like you're trying to steal their most precious possession.
wisdom.author: Jim Morrison

wisdom.quote: I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it.
wisdom.author: Charles Schultz

wisdom.quote: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
wisdom.author: Sharon Salzberg

wisdom.quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
wisdom.author: Anne Bradstreet

wisdom.quote: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Mockingbirds don’t do one thing but make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corncribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.
wisdom.author: Harper Lee

wisdom.quote: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right times.
wisdom.author: Patrick Rothfuss

wisdom.quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
wisdom.author: Mahatma Gandhi

wisdom.quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
wisdom.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

wisdom.quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
wisdom.author: Stephen Hawking

wisdom.quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Gaskell

wisdom.quote: This being human is a guest house. Every morning is a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor...Welcome and entertain them all. Treat each guest honorably. The dark thought, the shame, the malice, meet them at the door laughing, and invite them in. Be grateful for whoever comes, because each has been sent as a guide from beyond.
wisdom.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

wisdom.quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.
wisdom.author: Leo F. Buscaglia

wisdom.quote: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.quote: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil.
wisdom.author: Rick Riordan

wisdom.quote: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean.
wisdom.author: Bob Dylan

wisdom.quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
wisdom.author: Dhammapada

wisdom.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door
wisdom.author: Milton Berle

wisdom.quote: Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber.
wisdom.author: Kurt Vonnegut

wisdom.quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
wisdom.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

wisdom.quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.
wisdom.author: Bohdi Sanders

wisdom.quote: There are no ordinary moments.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman

wisdom.quote: Lost Time is never found again.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality.
wisdom.author: Dr Roopleen

wisdom.quote: Don’t only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets, for it and knowledge can raise men to the divine.
wisdom.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

wisdom.quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.
wisdom.author: D. Simone

wisdom.quote: But what if I make a mistake?' Will asked.Gilan threw back his head and laughed. 'A mistake? One mistake? You should be so lucky. You'll make dozens! I made four or five on my first day alone! Of course you'll make mistakes. Just don't make any of them twice. If you do mess things up, don't try to hide it. Don't try to rationalize it. Recognize it and admit it and learn from it. We never stop learning, none of us.
wisdom.author: John Flanagan

wisdom.quote: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.
wisdom.author: Robin  Williams

wisdom.quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.
wisdom.author: Sara Teasdale

wisdom.quote: V-Day…if you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for "your loved one" I think it’s quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. It’s all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.
wisdom.author: Jess C Scott

wisdom.quote: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat.
wisdom.author: Theodore Roosevelt

wisdom.quote: Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling.
wisdom.author: Carl Gustav Jung

wisdom.quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Don't just say you have read books. Show that through them you have learned to think better, to be a more discriminating and reflective person. Books are the training weights of the mind. They are very helpful, but it would be a bad mistake to suppose that one has made progress simply by having internalized their contents.
wisdom.author: Epictetus

wisdom.quote: I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.
wisdom.author: Orson Scott Card

wisdom.quote: For everything in this journey of life we are on, there is a right wing and a left wing: for the wing of love there is anger; for the wing of destiny there is fear; for the wing of pain there is healing; for the wing of hurt there is forgiveness; for the wing of pride there is humility; for the wing of giving there is taking; for the wing of tears there is joy; for the wing of rejection there is acceptance; for the wing of judgment there is grace; for the wing of honor there is shame; for the wing of letting go there is the wing of keeping. We can only fly with two wings and two wings can only stay in the air if there is a balance. Two beautiful wings is perfection. There is a generation of people who idealize perfection as the existence of only one of these wings every time. But I see that a bird with one wing is imperfect. An angel with one wing is imperfect. A butterfly with one wing is dead. So this generation of people strive to always cut off the other wing in the hopes of embodying their ideal of perfection, and in doing so, have created a crippled race.
wisdom.author: C. JoyBell C.

wisdom.quote: Now I understand that one of the important reasons for going to college and getting an education is to learn that the things you've believed in all your life aren't true, and that nothing is what it appears to be.
wisdom.author: Daniel Keyes

wisdom.quote: In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn.
wisdom.author: Octavia Butler

wisdom.quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
wisdom.author: Marcel Proust

wisdom.quote: In fact, the mere act of opening the box will determine the state of thecat, although in this case there were three determinate states the catcould be in: these being Alive, Dead, and Bloody Furious.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future.
wisdom.author: Niels Bohr

wisdom.quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.
wisdom.author: Leonardo da Vinci

wisdom.quote: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public.
wisdom.author: Cornel West

wisdom.quote: CHORONZON: I am a dire wolf, prey-stalking, lethal prowler.MORPHEUS: I am a hunter, horse-mounted, wolf-stabbing.CHORONZON: I am a horsefly, horse-stinging, hunter-throwing.MORPHEUS: I am a spider, fly-consuming, eight legged.CHORONZON: I am a snake, spider-devouring, posion-toothed.MORPHEUS: I am an ox, snake-crushing, heavy-footed.CHORONZON: I am an anthrax, butcher bacterium, warm-life destroying.MORPHEUS: I am a world, space-floating, life-nurturing.CHORONZON: I am a nova, all-exploding... planet-cremating.MORPHEUS: I am the Universe -- all things encompassing, all life embracing.CHORONZON: I am Anti-Life, the Beast of Judgment. I am the dark at the end of everything. The end of universes, gods, worlds... of everything. Sss. And what will you be then, Dreamlord?MORPHEUS: I am hope.
wisdom.author: Neil Gaiman

wisdom.quote: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.
wisdom.author: Siddhārtha Gautama

wisdom.quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life can’t work for you if you don’t show up as you.
wisdom.author: Jason Mraz

wisdom.quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged
wisdom.author: Heinrich Heine

wisdom.quote: Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.
wisdom.author: Steve Jobs

wisdom.quote: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.
wisdom.author: Eckhart Tolle

wisdom.quote: You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself.
wisdom.author: Galileo

wisdom.quote: Mama used to say, you have to know someone a thousand days before you can glimpse her soul.
wisdom.author: Shannon Hale

wisdom.quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
wisdom.author: Hemingway Ernest

wisdom.quote: Education is no substitute for intelligence.
wisdom.author: Frank Herbert

wisdom.quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton

wisdom.quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart.
wisdom.author: Charles Dickens

wisdom.quote: من نمّ لك نمّ بك, ومن نقل إليك نقل عنك, ومن إذا أرضيته فقال ماليس فيك, كذلك إذا أغضبته قال فيك ماليس فيك.
wisdom.author: محمد بن إدريس الشافعي

wisdom.quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: How can I be substantial if I do not cast a shadow? I must have a dark side also If I am to be whole.
wisdom.author: C.G. Jung

wisdom.quote: If others tell us something we make assumptions, and if they don't tell us something we make assumptions to fulfill our need to know and to replace the need to communicate. Even if we hear something and we don't understand we make assumptions about what it means and then believe the assumptions. We make all sorts of assumptions because we don't have the courage to ask questions.
wisdom.author: Miguel Ruiz

wisdom.quote: Don't go looking for boys in the darkThey will say pretty things thenleave you with scars.Do go looking for boys in the parkFor that is where the true gentlemen are.
wisdom.author: Anna Godbersen

wisdom.quote: Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.
wisdom.author: Scott Westerfeld

wisdom.quote: My soul is in the sky.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul.
wisdom.author: Walt whitman

wisdom.quote: There is an ancient tribal proverb I once heard in India. It says that before we can see properly we must first shed our tears to clear the way.
wisdom.author: Libba Bray

wisdom.quote: No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care
wisdom.author: Theodore Roosevelt

wisdom.quote: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.
wisdom.author: Frank Herbert

wisdom.quote: If you try to change it, you will ruin it. Try to hold it, and you will lose it.
wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

wisdom.quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not towisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
wisdom.author: Wallace Stegner

wisdom.quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.
wisdom.author: Epicurus

wisdom.quote: Wisdom.... comes not from age, but from education and learning.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: I've learned that you shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mitt on both hands; you need to be able to throw some things back.
wisdom.author: Maya Angelou

wisdom.quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
wisdom.author: Maurice Switzer

wisdom.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable.
wisdom.author: Jess C. Scott

wisdom.quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
wisdom.author: John Lennon

wisdom.quote: Hold fast to dreams,For if dreams dieLife is a broken-winged bird,That cannot fly.
wisdom.author: Langston Hughes

wisdom.quote: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: May you live every day of your life.
wisdom.author: Jonathan Swift

wisdom.quote: Never laugh at live dragons.
wisdom.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.
wisdom.author: Paulo Coelho

wisdom.quote: Any fool can know. The point is to understand.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: If you're reading this...Congratulations, you're alive.If that's not something to smile about,then I don't know what is.
wisdom.author: Chad Sugg

wisdom.quote: There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope.
wisdom.author: Alexandre Dumas

wisdom.quote: The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back.
wisdom.author: Abigail Van Buren

wisdom.quote: Think before you speak. Read before you think.
wisdom.author: Fran Lebowitz

wisdom.quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

wisdom.quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
wisdom.author: Paulo Coelho

wisdom.quote: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.
wisdom.author: Patrick Rothfuss

wisdom.quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
wisdom.author: Confucious

wisdom.quote: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.
wisdom.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: Angry people are not always wise.
wisdom.author: Jane Austen

wisdom.quote: You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you do.
wisdom.author: Patrick Ness

wisdom.quote: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

wisdom.quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
wisdom.author: Rumi

wisdom.quote: Never complain, never explain. Resist the temptation to defend yourself or make excuses.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: We seldom realize, for example that our most private thoughts and emotions are not actually our own. For we think in terms of languages and images which we did not invent, but which were given to us by our society.
wisdom.author: Alan Watts

wisdom.quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.quote: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long.Good things come to those who wait.
wisdom.author: Jess C. Scott

wisdom.quote: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise.
wisdom.author: George R.R. Martin

wisdom.quote: Time is a game played beautifully by children.
wisdom.author: Heraclitus

wisdom.quote: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known.
wisdom.author: A.A. Milne

wisdom.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

wisdom.quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.quote: Love is a form of prejudice. You love what you need, you love what makes you feel good, you love what is convenient. How can you say you love one person when there are ten thousand people in the world that you would love more if you ever met them? But you'll never meet them. All right, so we do the best we can. Granted. But we must still realize that love is just the result of a chance encounter. Most people make too much of it. On these grounds a good fuck is not to be entirely scorned. But that's the result of a chance meeting too. You're damned right. Drink up. We'll have another.
wisdom.author: Charles Bukowski

wisdom.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
wisdom.author: Francis Bacon

wisdom.quote: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
wisdom.author: Michael Levine

wisdom.quote: As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all - the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.
wisdom.author: J.K. Rowling

wisdom.quote: Suffering is a gift. In it is hidden mercy.
wisdom.author: Rumi

wisdom.quote: We have to create culture, don't watch TV, don't read magazines, don't even listen to NPR. Create your own roadshow. The nexus of space and time where you are now is the most immediate sector of your universe, and if you're worrying about Michael Jackson or Bill Clinton or somebody else, then you are disempowered, you're giving it all away to icons, icons which are maintained by an electronic media so that you want to dress like X or have lips like Y. This is shit-brained, this kind of thinking. That is all cultural diversion, and what is real is you and your friends and your associations, your highs, your orgasms, your hopes, your plans, your fears. And we are told 'no', we're unimportant, we're peripheral. 'Get a degree, get a job, get a this, get a that.' And then you're a player, you don't want to even play in that game. You want to reclaim your mind and get it out of the hands of the cultural engineers who want to turn you into a half-baked moron consuming all this trash that's being manufactured out of the bones of a dying world.
wisdom.author: Terence McKenna

wisdom.quote: Guard well your thoughts when alone and your words when accompanied.
wisdom.author: Roy T. Bennett

wisdom.quote: You're going to meet many people with domineering personalities: the loud, the obnoxious, those that noisily stake their claims in your territory and everywhere else they set foot on. This is the blueprint of a predator. Predators prey on gentleness, peace, calmness, sweetness and any positivity that they sniff out as weakness. Anything that is happy and at peace they mistake for weakness. It's not your job to change these people, but it's your job to show them that your peace and gentleness do not equate to weakness. I have always appeared to be fragile and delicate but the thing is, I am not fragile and I am not delicate. I am very gentle but I can show you that the gentle also possess a poison. I compare myself to silk. People mistake silk to be weak but a silk handkerchief can protect the wearer from a gunshot. There are many people who will want to befriend you if you fit the description of what they think is weak; predators want to have friends that they can dominate over because that makes them feel strong and important. The truth is that predators have no strength and no courage. It is you who are strong, and it is you who has courage. I have lost many a friend over the fact that when they attempt to rip me, they can't. They accuse me of being deceiving; I am not deceiving, I am just made of silk. It is they who are stupid and wrongly take gentleness and fairness for weakness. There are many more predators in this world, so I want you to be made of silk. You are silk.
wisdom.author: C. JoyBell C.

wisdom.quote: Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.
wisdom.author: C. S. Lewis

wisdom.quote: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win;Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.
wisdom.author: Louisa May Alcott

wisdom.quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
wisdom.author: George Orwell

wisdom.quote: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.
wisdom.author: Theodore Roosevelt

wisdom.quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.
wisdom.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

wisdom.quote: Inventory:"Four be the things I am wiser to know:Idleness, sorrow, a friend, and a foe.Four be the things I'd been better without:Love, curiosity, freckles, and doubt.Three be the things I shall never attain:Envy, content, and sufficient champagne.Three be the things I shall have till I die:Laughter and hope and a sock in the eye.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren't trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom.
wisdom.author: Umberto Eco

wisdom.quote: When a child asks you something, answer him, for goodness sake. But don't make a production of it. Children are children, but they can spot an evasion faster than adults, and evasion simply muddles 'em.
wisdom.author: Harper Lee

wisdom.quote: Remember, you cannot be both young and wise. Young people who pretend to be wise to the ways of the world are mostly just cynics. Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the farthest thing from it. Because cynics don’t learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness, a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say no. But saying "yes" begins things. Saying "yes" is how things grow. Saying "yes" leads to knowledge. "Yes" is for young people. So for as long as you have the strength to, say "yes'.
wisdom.author: Stephen Colbert

wisdom.quote: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement
wisdom.author: Jess C Scott

wisdom.quote: We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

wisdom.quote: It is not a daily increase, but a daily decrease. Hack away at the inessentials.
wisdom.author: Bruce Lee

wisdom.quote: My head’ll explode if I continue with this escapism.
wisdom.author: Jess C Scott

wisdom.quote: These violent delights have violent ends.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: The man of wisdom is never of two minds;the man of benevolence never worries;the man of courage is never afraid.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: When you make a choice, you change the future.
wisdom.author: Deepak Chopra

wisdom.quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.[Verse 223]
wisdom.author: Siddhārtha Gautama

wisdom.quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: I will no longer mutilate and destroy myself in order to find a secret behind the ruins.
wisdom.author: Hermann Hesse

wisdom.quote: The small wisdom is like water in a glass:clear, transparent, pure.The great wisdom is like the water in the sea:dark, mysterious, impenetrable.
wisdom.author: Rabindranath Tagore

wisdom.quote: ...Nobody knows like a woman how to say things that are both sweet and profound. Sweetness and depth, this is all of woman; this is Heaven.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.quote: Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Voici mon secret. Il est très simple: on ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.
wisdom.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

wisdom.quote: Books permit us to voyage through time, to tap the wisdom of our ancestors. The library connects us with the insight and knowledge, painfully extracted from Nature, of the greatest minds that ever were, with the best teachers, drawn from the entire planet and from all our history, to instruct us without tiring, and to inspire us to make our own contribution to the collective knowledge of the human species. I think the health of our civilization, the depth of our awareness about the underpinnings of our culture and our concern for the future can all be tested by how well we support our libraries.
wisdom.author: Carl Sagan

wisdom.quote: Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. This shows clearly the principle ofsoftness overcoming hardness.
wisdom.author: Lao Zi

wisdom.quote: When you look at what C.S. Lewis is saying, his message is so anti-life, so cruel, so unjust. The view that the Narnia books have for the material world is one of almost undisguised contempt. At one point, the old professor says, ‘It’s all in Plato’ — meaning that the physical world we see around us is the crude, shabby, imperfect, second-rate copy of something much better. I want to emphasize the simple physical truth of things, the absolute primacy of the material life, rather than the spiritual or the afterlife.[The New York Times interview, 2000]
wisdom.author: Philip Pullman

wisdom.quote: When in doubt, choose to live.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: The wisest are the most annoyed at the loss of time.
wisdom.author: Dante Alighieri

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is knowing I am nothing,Love is knowing I am everything,and between the two my life moves.
wisdom.author: Nisargadatta Maharaj

wisdom.quote: Hate is... It's too easy. Love. Love takes courage.
wisdom.author: Hannah Harrington

wisdom.quote: The sense of tragedy - according to Aristotle - comes, ironically enough, not from the protagonist's weak points but from his good qualities. Do you know what I'm getting at? People are drawn deeper into tragedy not by their defects but by their virtues....[But] we accept irony through a device called metaphor. And through that we grow and become deeper human beings.
wisdom.author: Haruki Murakami

wisdom.quote: I do not know everything; still many things I understand.
wisdom.author: Madeleine L'Engle

wisdom.quote: My feelings are too loud for words and too shy for the world.
wisdom.author: Dejan Stojanovic

wisdom.quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: Is there a difference between happiness and inner peace? Yes. Happiness depends on conditions being perceived as positive; inner peace does not.
wisdom.author: Eckhart Tolle

wisdom.quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Don’t take the high ground and assume you already know what you’ll do. The truth is, when it comes to someone you love, you’ll find there isn’t anything you won’t do.
wisdom.author: Richelle Mead

wisdom.quote: An acquaintance merely enjoys your company, a fair-weather companion flatters when all is well, a true friend has your best interests at heart and the pluck to tell you what you need to hear.
wisdom.author: E.A. Bucchianeri

wisdom.quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.
wisdom.author: Simone Elkeles

wisdom.quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.quote: The way out is through the door. Why is it that no one will use this method?
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is having things right in your lifeand knowing why.
wisdom.author: William Stafford

wisdom.quote: Before I can live with other folks I’ve got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.
wisdom.author: Harper Lee

wisdom.quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
wisdom.author: Emerson

wisdom.quote: I feel sorry for anyone who is in a place where he feels strange and stupid.
wisdom.author: Lois Lowry

wisdom.quote: Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world.
wisdom.author: Heraclitus

wisdom.quote: Women may fall when there's no strength in men.Act II
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: A man without words is a man without thought.
wisdom.author: John Steinbeck

wisdom.quote: I cannot compromise my respect for your love. You can keep your love, I will keep my respect.
wisdom.author: Amit Kalantri

wisdom.quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
wisdom.author: Wil Zeus

wisdom.quote: الحب هو ذكاء المسافة، ألّا تقترب كثيرًا فتلغي اللهفة، ولا تبتعد طويلًا فتُنسى.
wisdom.author: أحلام مستغانمي

wisdom.quote: Treachery and violence are spears pointed at both ends; they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies.
wisdom.author: Emily Brontë

wisdom.quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
wisdom.author: Kahlil Gibran

wisdom.quote: Sometimes you weren't supposed to share pain. Sometimes it was best just to deal with it alone.
wisdom.author: Sarah Addison Allen

wisdom.quote: To wisely live your life, you don't need to know muchJust remember two main rules for the beginning:You better starve, than eat whateverAnd better be alone, than with whoever.
wisdom.author: Omar Khayyám

wisdom.quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy
wisdom.author: Isaac Newton

wisdom.quote: If curiosity killed the cat, it was satisfaction that brought it back.
wisdom.author: Holly Black

wisdom.quote: I do believe in simplicity. It is astonishing as well as sad, how many trivial affairs even the wisest thinks he must attend to in a day; how singular an affair he thinks he must omit. When the mathematician would solve a difficult problem, he first frees the equation of all incumbrances, and reduces it to its simplest terms. So simplify the problem of life, distinguish the necessary and the real. Probe the earth to see where your main roots run.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: I finally know the difference between pleasing and loving, obeying and respecting. It has taken me so many years to be okay with being different, and with being this alive, this intense. (xxvi)
wisdom.author: Eve Ensler

wisdom.quote: [The Old Astronomer to His Pupil]Reach me down my Tycho Brahe, I would know him when we meet,When I share my later science, sitting humbly at his feet;He may know the law of all things, yet be ignorant of howWe are working to completion, working on from then to now.Pray remember that I leave you all my theory complete,Lacking only certain data for your adding, as is meet,And remember men will scorn it, 'tis original and true,And the obloquy of newness may fall bitterly on you.But, my pupil, as my pupil you have learned the worth of scorn,You have laughed with me at pity, we have joyed to be forlorn,What for us are all distractions of men's fellowship and smiles;What for us the Goddess Pleasure with her meretricious smiles.You may tell that German College that their honor comes too late,But they must not waste repentance on the grizzly savant's fate.Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.What, my boy, you are not weeping? You should save your eyes for sight;You will need them, mine observer, yet for many another night.I leave none but you, my pupil, unto whom my plans are known.You 'have none but me,' you murmur, and I 'leave you quite alone'?Well then, kiss me, -- since my mother left her blessing on my brow,There has been a something wanting in my nature until now;I can dimly comprehend it, -- that I might have been more kind,Might have cherished you more wisely, as the one I leave behind.I 'have never failed in kindness'? No, we lived too high for strife,--Calmest coldness was the error which has crept into our life;But your spirit is untainted, I can dedicate you stillTo the service of our science: you will further it? you will!There are certain calculations I should like to make with you,To be sure that your deductions will be logical and true;And remember, 'Patience, Patience,' is the watchword of a sage,Not to-day nor yet to-morrow can complete a perfect age.I have sown, like Tycho Brahe, that a greater man may reap;But if none should do my reaping, 'twill disturb me in my sleepSo be careful and be faithful, though, like me, you leave no name;See, my boy, that nothing turn you to the mere pursuit of fame.I must say Good-bye, my pupil, for I cannot longer speak;Draw the curtain back for Venus, ere my vision grows too weak:It is strange the pearly planet should look red as fiery Mars,--God will mercifully guide me on my way amongst the stars.
wisdom.author: Sarah   Williams

wisdom.quote: Life—the way it really is—is a battle not between good and bad, but between bad and worse
wisdom.author: Joseph Brodsky

wisdom.quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Positive expectations are the mark of the superior personality.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: I've come to believe that all my past failure and frustration were actually laying the foundation for the understandings that have created the new level of living I now enjoy.
wisdom.author: Anthony Robbins

wisdom.quote: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him will believeth in anything. - Hitchens 3:16
wisdom.author: Christopher Hitchens

wisdom.quote: Stories have a way of changing faces. They are unruly things, undisciplined, given to delinquency and the throwing of erasers. This is why we must close them up into thick, solid books, so they cannot get out and cause trouble.
wisdom.author: Catherynne M. Valente

wisdom.quote: People who have a religion should be glad, for not everyone has the gift of believing in heavenly things. You don't necessarily even have to be afraid of punishment after death; purgatory, hell, and heaven are things that a lot of people can't accept, but still a religion, it doesn't matter which, keeps a person on the right path. It isn't the fear of God but the upholding of one's own honor and conscience. How noble and good everyone could be if, every evening before falling asleep, they were to recall to their minds the events of the while day and consider exactly what has been good and bad. Then, without realizing it you try to improve yourself at the start of each new day; of course, you achieve quite a lot in the course of time. Anyone can do this, it costs nothing and is certainly very helpful. Whoever doesn't know it must learn and find by experience that: "A quiet conscience mades one strong!
wisdom.author: Anne Frank

wisdom.quote: That's not a bad word...hate and war are bad words, but fuck isn't.
wisdom.author: Judy Blume

wisdom.quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.
wisdom.author: A.J. RUSSELL

wisdom.quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their gray visions they obtain glimpses of eternity, and thrill, in waking, to find that they have been upon the verge of the great secret. In snatches, they learn something of the wisdom which is of good, and more of the mere knowledge which is of evil.
wisdom.author: Edgar Allan Poe

wisdom.quote: Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.
wisdom.author: Karl Lagerfeld

wisdom.quote: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
wisdom.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
wisdom.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

wisdom.quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, "What's in it for me?
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.Listen to it carefully.
wisdom.author: Richard Bach

wisdom.quote: Wise? No, I simply learned to think.
wisdom.author: Christopher Paolini

wisdom.quote: Sure, we'd faced some things as children that a lot of kids don't. Sure, Justin had qualified for his Junior de Sade Badge in his teaching methods for dealing with pain. We still hadn't learned, though, that growing up is all about getting hurt. And then getting over it. You hurt. You recover. You move on. Odds are pretty good you're just going to get hurt again. But each time, you learn something.Each time, you come out of it a little stronger, and at some point you realize that there are more flavors of pain than coffee. There's the little empty pain of leaving something behind - gradutaing, taking the next step forward, walking out of something familiar and safe into the unknown. There's the big, whirling pain of life upending all of your plans and expecations. There's the sharp little pains of failure, and the more obscure aches of successes that didn't give you what you thought they would. There are the vicious, stabbing pains of hopes being torn up. The sweet little pains of finding others, giving them your love, and taking joy in their life they grow and learn. There's the steady pain of empathy that you shrug off so you can stand beside a wounded friend and help them bear their burdens. And if you're very, very lucky, there are a very few blazing hot little pains you feel when you realized that you are standing in a moment of utter perfection, an instant of triumph, or happiness, or mirth which at the same time cannot possibly last - and yet will remain with you for life.Everyone is down on pain, because they forget something important about it: Pain is for the living. Only the dead don't feel it.Pain is a part of life. Sometimes it's a big part, and sometimes it isn't, but either way, it's a part of the big puzzle, the deep music, the great game. Pain does two things: It teaches you, tells you that you're alive. Then it passes away and leaves you changed. It leaves you wiser, sometimes. Sometimes it leaves you stronger. Either way, pain leaves its mark, and everything important that will ever happen to you in life is going to involve it in one degree or another.
wisdom.author: Jim Butcher

wisdom.quote: The lotus is the most beautiful flower, whose petals open one by one. But it will only grow in the mud. In order to grow and gain wisdom, first you must have the mud --- the obstacles of life and its suffering. ... The mud speaks of the common ground that humans share, no matter what our stations in life. ... Whether we have it all or we have nothing, we are all faced with the same obstacles: sadness, loss, illness, dying and death. If we are to strive as human beings to gain more wisdom, more kindness and more compassion, we must have the intention to grow as a lotus and open each petal one by one.
wisdom.author: Goldie Hawn

wisdom.quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,
wisdom.author: Amit Ray

wisdom.quote: There is more in you of good than you know, child of the kindly West. Some courage and some wisdom, blended in measure. If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
wisdom.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

wisdom.quote: It takes a very long time to become young.
wisdom.author: Pablo Picasso

wisdom.quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
wisdom.author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

wisdom.quote: People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does.
wisdom.author: Michel Foucault

wisdom.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems -- not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses.
wisdom.author: William Arthur Ward

wisdom.quote: I felt like an animal, and animals don’t know sin, do they?
wisdom.author: Jess C. Scott

wisdom.quote: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman

wisdom.quote: I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.
wisdom.author: Khalil Gibran

wisdom.quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
wisdom.author: William James

wisdom.quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
wisdom.author: Baltasar Gracian

wisdom.quote: Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you security and friendship and didn't ask for anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly. Love, truth, beauty, wisdom and consolation against death. Who had said that? Someone else who loved books.
wisdom.author: Cornelia Funke

wisdom.quote: Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own.
wisdom.author: Joss Whedon

wisdom.quote: It's now very common to hear people say, 'I'm rather offended by that.' As if that gives them certain rights. It's actually nothing more... than a whine. 'I find that offensive.' It has no meaning; it has no purpose; it has no reason to be respected as a phrase. 'I am offended by that.' Well, so fucking what."[I saw hate in a graveyard -- Stephen Fry, The Guardian, 5 June 2005]
wisdom.author: Stephen Fry

wisdom.quote: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely.
wisdom.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

wisdom.quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
wisdom.author: Thomas Szasz

wisdom.quote: wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.
wisdom.author: Gabriel García Márquez

wisdom.quote: A smart person knows how to talk. A wise person knows when to be silent.
wisdom.author: Roy T. Bennett

wisdom.quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made,What's a sundial in the shade?
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: No man is poor who has a Godly mother.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.quote: No, that is the great fallacy: the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful.
wisdom.author: Ernest Hemingway

wisdom.quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying in other words that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.
wisdom.author: Alexander Pope

wisdom.quote: Love only grows by sharing. You can only have more for yourself by giving it away to others.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Life doesn't make any sense, and we all pretend it does. Comedy's job is to point out that it doesn't make sense, and that it doesn't make much difference anyway.
wisdom.author: Eric Idle

wisdom.quote: Don't wish it was easier wish you were better. Don't wish for less problems wish for more skills. Don't wish for less challenge wish for more wisdom
wisdom.author: Jim Rohn

wisdom.quote: How prone to doubt, how cautious are the wise!
wisdom.author: Homer

wisdom.quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't three lefts make a right? Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't two negatives make a positive?
wisdom.author: Andrew Clements

wisdom.quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
wisdom.author: Horace

wisdom.quote: But if you believe yourself worthy of the thing you fought so hard to get, then you become an instrument of God, you help the Soul of the World, and you understand why you are here.
wisdom.author: Paulo Coelho

wisdom.quote: Hide yourself in God, so when a man wants to find you he will have to go there first.
wisdom.author: Shannon L. Alder

wisdom.quote: It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.
wisdom.author: Dejan Stojanovic

wisdom.quote: If everything seems under control, you're not going fast enough.
wisdom.author: Mario Andretti

wisdom.quote: Time flows away like the water in the river.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: Everything you do is triggered by an emotion of either desire or fear.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Every form of art is another way of seeing the world. Another perspective, another window. And science –that’s the most spectacular window of all. You can see the entire universe from there.
wisdom.author: Claudia Gray

wisdom.quote: Everything you'll ever need to know is within you; the secrets of the universe are imprinted on the cells of your body.
wisdom.author: Dan Millman

wisdom.quote: Mom, how do you know if the guy is the guy?"You mean if he’ll be a good husband?" She pauses, then says "The ticket is for the man to love the woman more than she loves him."Shouldn’t it be equal?"Mom cackles. "It can never be equal."But what if the woman loves the man more?"A life of hell awaits her. As women, the deck is stacked against us because time is our enemy. We age, while men season. And trust me, there are plenty of women out there looking for a man, and they don’t mind staking a claim on somebody else’s husband, no matter how old, creaky, and deaf they are.
wisdom.author: Adriana Trigiani

wisdom.quote: The nail that sticks out farthest gets hammered the hardest.
wisdom.author: Patrick Jones

wisdom.quote: The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
wisdom.author: Anthony Robbins

wisdom.quote: I'm trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I'm not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.[Washington Post interview, 19 February 2001]
wisdom.author: philip pullman

wisdom.quote: Mistakes are the growing pains of wisdom.
wisdom.author: William Jordan

wisdom.quote: Jasnah had once defined a fool as a person who ignored information because it disagreed with desired results.
wisdom.author: Brandon Sanderson

wisdom.quote: The future was one thing that could never be broken, because it had not yet had the chance to be anything.
wisdom.author: Sarah Dessen

wisdom.quote: When health is absent, wisdom cannot reveal itself, art cannot manifest, strength cannot fight, wealth becomes useless, and intelligence cannot be applied.
wisdom.author: Herophilus

wisdom.quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
wisdom.author: Voltaire

wisdom.quote: I'm not lost, because I haven't any idea where to go that I might get lost on the way to. I'd like to get lost, because then I'd know where I was going, you see.
wisdom.author: Catherynne M. Valente

wisdom.quote: If we don't change the direction we are headed, we will end up where we are going.
wisdom.author: Jodi Picoult

wisdom.quote: I thought to myself: I am wiser than this man; neither of us probably knows anything that is really good, but he thinks he has knowledge, when he has not, while I, having no knowledge, do not think I have.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
wisdom.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

wisdom.quote: Fame is a vapor, popularity is an accident, riches take wings, those who cheer today may curse tomorrow and only one thing endures - character.
wisdom.author: Harry Truman

wisdom.quote: If you're gonna burn a bridge behind you, make sure you've crossed it first.
wisdom.author: Quentin R. Bufogle

wisdom.quote: من قال لك أن درب الجنة معبد بالورود؟
wisdom.author: أحمد خيري العمري

wisdom.quote: The first peace, which is the most important, is that which comes within the souls of people when they realize their relationship, their oneness with the universe and all its powers, and when they realize at the center of the universe dwells the Great Spirit, and that its center is really everywhere, it is within each of us.
wisdom.author: Black Elk

wisdom.quote: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
wisdom.author: Ansel Adams

wisdom.quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin

wisdom.quote: Acquiring wisdom is great but it is not the goal, applying it is.
wisdom.author: idowu koyenikan

wisdom.quote: Whatever happens to your body, your soul will survive, untouched...
wisdom.author: J.K. Rowling

wisdom.quote: The life you have left is a gift. Cherish it. Enjoy it now, to the fullest. Do what matters, now.
wisdom.author: Leo Babauta

wisdom.quote: And thus, the actions of life often not allowing any delay, it is a truth very certain that, when it is not in our power to determine the most true opinions we ought to follow the most probable.
wisdom.author: Rene Descartes

wisdom.quote: Sometimes wisdom came from strange places, even from giant teenaged goldfish.
wisdom.author: Rick Riordan

wisdom.quote: Great spirits have always encountered opposition from mediocre minds. The mediocre mind is incapable of understanding the man who refuses to bow blindly to conventional prejudices and chooses instead to express his opinions courageously and honestly.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.quote: Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Anarchism is founded on the observation that since few men are wise enough to rule themselves, even fewer are wise enough to rule others.
wisdom.author: Edward Abbey

wisdom.quote: Do not look for happiness outside yourself. The awakened seek happiness inside.
wisdom.author: Peter Deunov

wisdom.quote: I criticize by creation, not by finding fault.
wisdom.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

wisdom.quote: And I despise your books, I despise wisdom and the blessings of this world. It is all worthless, fleeting, illusory, and deceptive, like a mirage. You may be proud, wise, and fine, but death will wipe you off the face of the earth as though you were no more than mice burrowing under the floor, and your posterity, your history, your immortal geniuses will burn or freeze together with the earthly globe.
wisdom.author: Anton Chekhov

wisdom.quote: Life is like a sandwich!Birth as one slice,and death as the other.What you put in-between the slices is up to you.Is your sandwich tasty or sour?Allan Rufus.org
wisdom.author: Allan Rufus

wisdom.quote: Whenever a theory appears to you as the only possible one, take this as a sign that you have neither understood the theory nor the problem which it was intended to solve.
wisdom.author: Karl Popper

wisdom.quote: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
wisdom.author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

wisdom.quote: One must find the source within one's own Self, one must possess it. Everything else was seeking -- a detour, an error.
wisdom.author: Hermann Hesse

wisdom.quote: A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell.
wisdom.author: Thomas Fuller

wisdom.quote: There will come a time in your life when you lose something that matters to you. You'll fight for it and you won't win. But what really matters isn't the war you're waging, it's that you don't lose the person you are in the midst of the battle.
wisdom.author: J. Sterling

wisdom.quote: The world’s greatest achievers have been those who have always stayed focussed on their goals and have been consistent in their efforts.
wisdom.author: Dr Roopleen

wisdom.quote: He who binds to himself a joyDoes the winged life destroy;But he who kisses the joy as it fliesLives in eternity's sun rise.
wisdom.author: William Blake

wisdom.quote: You'll never reach perfection because there's always room for improvement. Yet get along the way to perfection, you'll learn to get better.
wisdom.author: Hlovate

wisdom.quote: Some people insist that 'mediocre' is better than 'best.' They delight in clipping wings because they themselves can't fly. They despise brains because they have none.
wisdom.author: Robert A. Heinlein

wisdom.quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
wisdom.author: Kahlil Gibran

wisdom.quote: They can't tell so much about you if you got your eyes closed.
wisdom.author: Ken Kesey

wisdom.quote: Ignorance is hardly unusual, Miss Davar. The longer I live, the more I come to realize that it is the natural state of the human mind. There are many who will strive to defend its sanctity and then expect you to be impressed with their efforts.
wisdom.author: Brandon Sanderson

wisdom.quote: For this feeling of wonder shows that you are a philosopher, since wonder is the only beginning of philosophy.
wisdom.author: Plato

wisdom.quote: Time ripens all things; no man is born wise.
wisdom.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

wisdom.quote: Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.quote: Don't go on discussing what a good person should be. Just be one.
wisdom.author: Marcus Aurelius

wisdom.quote: I'VE LEARNED THAT YOU CAN'T CONTROL WHAT OTHER PEOPLE ARE GOING TO THINK ABOUT YOU.THE BEST YOU CAN DO IN LIFE IS NOT PISS YOURSELFOFF.
wisdom.author: Megan McCafferty

wisdom.quote: Things are not always what they seem; the first appearance deceives many; the intelligence of a few perceives what has been carefully hidden.
wisdom.author: Phaedrus

wisdom.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: The ability to discipline yourself to delay gratification in the short term in order to enjoy greater rewards in the long term, is the indispensable prerequisite for success.
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: Is it so far from madness to wisdom?" - Daenerys Targaryen
wisdom.author: George R.R. Martin

wisdom.quote: Humor can get in under the door while seriousness is still fumbling at the handle.
wisdom.author: G.K. Chesterton

wisdom.quote: We need not take refuge in supernatural gods to explain our saints and sages and heroes and statesmen, as if to explain our disbelief that mere unaided human beings could be that good or wise.
wisdom.author: Abraham Maslow

wisdom.quote: The mind is a wonderful servant, but a terrible master.
wisdom.author: Robin Sharma

wisdom.quote: You're thinking about something, and it makes you forget to talk.
wisdom.author: Lewis Carroll

wisdom.quote: There were many terrible things in my life and most of them never happened.
wisdom.author: Michel de Montaigne

wisdom.quote: There are many goals but one path - the path of compassion.
wisdom.author: Amit Ray

wisdom.quote: He who speaks without an attentive ear is mute.
wisdom.author: Stephen King

wisdom.quote: Wisdom is one of the few things that looks bigger the further away it is.
wisdom.author: Terry Pratchett

wisdom.quote: Always choose the future over the past. What do we do now?
wisdom.author: Brian Tracy

wisdom.quote: I visited many places, Some of them quite Exotic and far away, But I always returned to myself.
wisdom.author: Dejan Stojanovic

wisdom.quote: A person's rightful due is to be treated as an object of love, not as an object for use.
wisdom.author: Pope John Paul II

wisdom.quote: In examining disease, we gain wisdom about anatomy and physiology and biology. In examining the person with disease, we gain wisdom about life.
wisdom.author: Oliver W. Sacks

wisdom.quote: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge the more grief.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

wisdom.quote: In the heartfelt mercy of our God, the dawn from on high will visit us, to shine on those sitting in darkness, in the shadow of death, to guide our feet to the way of peace.
wisdom.author: Anonymous

wisdom.quote: Suppose that we are wise enough to learn and know—and yet not wise enough to control our learning and knowledge, so that we use it to destroy ourselves? Even if that is so, knowledge remains better than ignorance. It is better to know—even if the knowledge endures only for the moment that comes before destruction—than to gain eternal life at the price of a dull and swinish lack of comprehension of a universe that swirls unseen before us in all its wonder. That was the choice of Achilles, and it is mine, too.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: The Master said, "A true teacher is one who, keeping the past alive, is also able to understand the present."(Analects 2.11)
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.quote: We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.
wisdom.author: Karl Lagerfeld

wisdom.quote: This world is your best teacher. There is a lesson in everything. There is a lesson in each experience. Learn it and become wise. Every failure is a stepping stone to success. Every difficulty or disappointment is a trial of your faith. Every unpleasant incident or temptation is a test of your inner strength. Therefore nil desperandum. March forward hero!
wisdom.author: Sivananda

wisdom.quote: Men have two greatest fears: the first fear is the fear of being needed, and the second fear is the fear of not being needed.
wisdom.author: C. JoyBell C.

wisdom.quote: Don't be afraid of the shadows, that only means there's a light nearby.
wisdom.author: Evanescence

wisdom.quote: REMEMBER YOUR GREATNESSBefore you were born,And were still too tiny forThe human eye to see,You won the race for lifeFrom among 250 million competitors.And yet,How fast you have forgottenYour strength,When your very existenceIs proof of your greatness.You were born a winner,A warrior,One who defied the oddsBy surviving the most gruesomeBattle of them all.And now that you are a giant,Why do you even doubt victoryAgainst smaller numbers,And wider margins?The only walls that exist,Are those you have placed in your mind.And whatever obstacles you conceive,Exist only because you have forgottenWhat you have alreadyAchieved.Poetry by Suzy Kassem
wisdom.author: Suzy Kassem

wisdom.quote: IthakaAs you set out for Ithakahope the voyage is a long one,full of adventure, full of discovery.Laistrygonians and Cyclops,angry Poseidon—don’t be afraid of them:you’ll never find things like that on your wayas long as you keep your thoughts raised high,as long as a rare excitementstirs your spirit and your body.Laistrygonians and Cyclops,wild Poseidon—you won’t encounter themunless you bring them along inside your soul,unless your soul sets them up in front of you. Hope the voyage is a long one.May there be many a summer morning when,with what pleasure, what joy,you come into harbors seen for the first time;may you stop at Phoenician trading stationsto buy fine things,mother of pearl and coral, amber and ebony,sensual perfume of every kind—as many sensual perfumes as you can;and may you visit many Egyptian citiesto gather stores of knowledge from their scholars. Keep Ithaka always in your mind.Arriving there is what you are destined for.But do not hurry the journey at all.Better if it lasts for years,so you are old by the time you reach the island,wealthy with all you have gained on the way,not expecting Ithaka to make you rich. Ithaka gave you the marvelous journey.Without her you would not have set out.She has nothing left to give you now. And if you find her poor, Ithaka won’t have fooled you.Wise as you will have become, so full of experience,you will have understood by then what these Ithakas mean.
wisdom.author: C.P. Cavafy

wisdom.quote: There are women who make things better... simply by showing up. There are women who make things happen. There are women who make their way. There are women who make a difference. And women who make us smile. There are women of wit and wisdom who- through strength and courage- make it through. There are women who change the world everyday... Women like you.
wisdom.author: Ashley Rice

wisdom.quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.
wisdom.author: Lisa Lutz

wisdom.quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.The teacher who walks in the shadow of the temple, among his followers, gives not of his wisdom but rather of his faith and his lovingness.If he is indeed wise he does not bid you enter the house of his wisdom, but rather leads you to the threshold of your own mind.
wisdom.author: Khalil Gibran

wisdom.quote: Love of music, of sunsets and sea; a liking for the same kind of people; political opinions that are not radically divergent; a similar stance as we look at the stars and think of the marvelous strangeness of the universe - these are what build a marriage. And it is never to be taken for granted.
wisdom.author: Madeleine L'Engle

wisdom.quote: The happiness of the drop is to die in the river.
wisdom.author: Imam Al-Ghazali

wisdom.quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise; seek what they sought.
wisdom.author: Matsuo Basho

wisdom.quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
wisdom.author: Eric Berne
